A multi-level evaluation framework integrates semantic validation, stylistic analysis, and perceptual metrics to assess both structural and content-level correctness. Extensive experiments on MLLMs reveal critical limitations in numerical precision and code synthesis, emphasizing the need for structured reasoning beyond surface-level perception. By unifying symbolic and data-driven grounding, ChartAnchor establishes a rigorous foundation for chart grounding, offering meaningful insights for advancing MLLMs in scientific, financial, and industrial domains.

AI.tldr: ChartAnchor 是一个大型基准，包含8k+的图-表-代码三元组，涵盖30种不同类型的图表，旨在全面评估大型语言模型在数值精度和代码生成方面的表现。
AI.motivation: 现有的基准存在图表多样性受限、孤立任务以及评估框架不完善的问题，无法全面评估模型的图表接地能力。为此，研究者提出了ChartAnchor基准，以解决这些问题。
AI.method: ChartAnchor包含两个互补任务：图表到代码的生成（合成可执行代码以复制图表）和受控的图表到表格的重构（提取确切数据并带有预定义的标题），并通过多级评价框架进行评估，该框架包括语义验证、风格分析和感知度量。
AI.result: 实验表明，大型语言模型在数值精度和代码合成方面存在关键限制，强调了超越表面感知进行结构化推理的需求。ChartAnchor为图表推理提供了坚实的评估基础。
AI.conclusion: ChartAnchor通过统一符号性和数据驱动的接地，建立了图表接地的严格基础，为科学、金融和工业领域内大型语言模型的进步提供了有价值的洞察。

title: A Systematic Characterization of LLM Inference on GPUs
summary: This work presents a systematic characterization of Large Language Model (LLM) inference to address fragmented understanding. Through comprehensive experiments, we establish a four-dimensional analytical framework: (1) Two-Phase Heterogeneity Observation; (2) Microarchitectural Root Cause Analysis; (3) System Scaling Principles; and (4) Emerging Paradigm Boundaries. Our investigation progresses systematically from observation to foresight: identifying performance phenomena, revealing hardware causes, validating system behavior, and exploring new paradigms. This study not only consolidates a reliable empirical foundation for existing research but also provides new discoveries and practical optimization guidance for LLM inference.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过全面实验建立了四维分析框架，从现象识别、硬件原因揭示、系统行为验证到新范式探索，为LLM推理提供了可靠的经验基础和新的发现及优化指导。
AI.motivation: 解决对大型语言模型推理认知碎片化的挑战，促进对LLM推理工作的系统理解。
AI.method: 通过全面的实验建立了四维度的分析框架，包括两个阶段的异质观测、微架构原因分析、系统扩展原则和新兴范式边界。
AI.result: 识别了性能现象，揭示了硬件原因，验证了系统行为，并探索了新的范式。不仅巩固了现有的研究成果，还为LLM推理提供了新的启示和优化指导。
AI.conclusion: 该研究为LLM推理提供了系统化的分析框架，不仅是经验基础的强化，也为未来的研究提供了探索方向。

title: Accelerating Bangla NLP Tasks with Automatic Mixed Precision: Resource-Efficient Training Preserving Model Efficacy
summary: Training models for Natural Language Processing (NLP) requires substantial computational resources and time, posing significant challenges, especially for NLP development in Bangla, where access to high-end hardware is often limited. In this work, we explore automatic mixed precision (AMP) training as a means to improve computational efficiency without sacrificing model performance. By leveraging a dynamic mix of 16-bit and 32-bit floating-point computations, AMP lowers GPU memory requirements and speeds up training without degrading model performance. We evaluate AMP across four standard Bangla NLP tasks, namely sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, error classification, and question answering, using four transformer-based models: BanglaBERT, BanglishBERT, XLM-R, and mBERT. Our results demonstrate that AMP accelerates training by 44.5% and reduces memory consumption by 17.6%, while maintaining F-1 score within 99.7% of the full-precision baselines. This empirical study highlights AMP's potential to democratize access to state-of-the-art NLP capabilities in hardware-constrained settings by lowering computational barriers.

AI.tldr: 通过采用自动混合精度（AMP）训练，本研究展示了其在四类典型孟加拉语NLP任务中的有效性，实现了训练加速44.5%，内存减少17.6%的效果，同时保持了接近全精度模型的F-1分数。
AI.motivation: 现有的自然语言处理（NLP）训练过程需要大量的计算资源和时间，对于资源受限的背景下，特别是孟加拉语NLP开发，这是一个巨大挑战。本研究旨在探索通过自动混合精度（AMP）训练来提高计算效率，同时保持模型性能，以缓解这一问题。
AI.method: 研究采用了基于变压器架构的四种NLP模型：BanglaBERT、BanglishBERT、XLM-R和mBERT，对四种典型孟加拉语NLP任务（情感分析、命名实体识别、错误分类和问答）进行了自动混合精度训练效果的评估。
AI.result: 研究结果表明，自动混合精度训练可以使训练速度提高44.5%，内存消耗降低17.6%，同时保持F-1分数与全精度基线相差不到1%。
AI.conclusion: 本研究证明了自动混合精度训练法在资源受限环境下大幅降低计算障碍的潜力，有助于推广先进技术至更多场景。

title: HIMOSA: Efficient Remote Sensing Image Super-Resolution with Hierarchical Mixture of Sparse Attention
summary: In remote sensing applications, such as disaster detection and response, real-time efficiency and model lightweighting are of critical importance. Consequently, existing remote sensing image super-resolution methods often face a trade-off between model performance and computational efficiency. In this paper, we propose a lightweight super-resolution framework for remote sensing imagery, named HIMOSA. Specifically, HIMOSA leverages the inherent redundancy in remote sensing imagery and introduces a content-aware sparse attention mechanism, enabling the model to achieve fast inference while maintaining strong reconstruction performance. Furthermore, to effectively leverage the multi-scale repetitive patterns found in remote sensing imagery, we introduce a hierarchical window expansion and reduce the computational complexity by adjusting the sparsity of the attention. Extensive experiments on multiple remote sensing datasets demonstrate that our method achieves state-of-the-art performance while maintaining computational efficiency.

AI.tldr: HIMOSA提出了一个轻量级的遥感影像超分辨率框架，通过引入内容感知稀疏注意力机制和层次窗口扩展，提高了推理速度并保持了重建性能。
AI.motivation: 现有遥感图像超分辨率方法在模型性能和计算效率之间存在权衡，HIMOSA旨在解决这一问题，以满足远程 sensing 应用中实时性和模型轻量化的关键需求。
AI.method: HIMOSA通过利用遥感图像中的固有冗余性，引入内容感知稀疏注意力机制，并采用层次窗口扩展来处理多尺度重复模式，从而实现高效推理。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，HIMOSA在多个遥感数据集上超越了其他方法，同时保持了计算效率。
AI.conclusion: HIMOSA框架为遥感图像超分辨率提供了新的解决方案，能够在保证重建性能的同时显著提升计算效率。

title: Evaluating Legal Reasoning Traces with Legal Issue Tree Rubrics
summary: Evaluating the quality of LLM-generated reasoning traces in expert domains (e.g., law) is essential for ensuring credibility and explainability, yet remains challenging due to the inherent complexity of such reasoning tasks. We introduce LEGIT (LEGal Issue Trees), a novel large-scale (24K instances) expert-level legal reasoning dataset with an emphasis on reasoning trace evaluation. We convert court judgments into hierarchical trees of opposing parties' arguments and the court's conclusions, which serve as rubrics for evaluating the issue coverage and correctness of the reasoning traces. We verify the reliability of these rubrics via human expert annotations and comparison with coarse, less informative rubrics. Using the LEGIT dataset, we show that (1) LLMs' legal reasoning ability is seriously affected by both legal issue coverage and correctness, and that (2) retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and RL with rubrics bring complementary benefits for legal reasoning abilities, where RAG improves overall reasoning capability, whereas RL improves correctness albeit with reduced coverage.

AI.tldr: 该研究引入了一个大规模的新型法律推理数据集LEGIT，用于评估LLM生成的推理痕迹质量，发现LLM的法律推理能力受法律问题覆盖和正确性影响，并且RAG和结合rubrics的RL对法律推理能力有互补的提升。
AI.motivation: 研究动机在于通过引入LEGIT数据集来解决LLM在复杂法律领域中推理质量评估的挑战，以提高其在这些领域的可靠性和可解释性。
AI.method: 研究方法包括将法院判决转化为层次结构的争论树，作为评估推理痕迹的标准。通过人类专家注解验证这些标准的可靠性，并使用这些数据集来评估LLM的能力，并且研究RAG和结合rubrics的RL在法律推理中的效果。
AI.result: 研究结果表明LLM在法律推理中的能力受法律问题覆盖和正确性影响显著。RAG和结合rubrics的RL对法律推理能力有不同程度的提升，分别提高了整体推理能力和准确率但减少了覆盖范围。
AI.conclusion: 综上所述，研究结论是LLM在法律推理任务中的表现可以得到进一步改进，特别是通过使用RAG和结合特定rubrics的RL方法来提升推理的准确性和全面性。

title: WaterSearch: A Quality-Aware Search-based Watermarking Framework for Large Language Models
summary:
Watermarking acts as a critical safeguard in text generated by Large Language Models (LLMs). By embedding identifiable signals into model outputs, watermarking enables reliable attribution and enhances the security of machine-generated content. Existing approaches typically embed signals by manipulating token generation probabilities. Despite their effectiveness, these methods inherently face a trade-off between detectability and text quality: the signal strength and randomness required for robust watermarking tend to degrade the performance of downstream tasks.
  In this paper, we design a novel embedding scheme that controls seed pools to facilitate diverse parallel generation of watermarked text. Based on that scheme, we propose WaterSearch, a sentence-level, search-based watermarking framework adaptable to a wide range of existing methods. WaterSearch enhances text quality by jointly optimizing two key aspects: 1) distribution fidelity and 2) watermark signal characteristics. Furthermore, WaterSearch is complemented by a sentence-level detection method with strong attack robustness. We evaluate our method on three popular LLMs across ten diverse tasks. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our method achieves an average performance improvement of 51.01\% over state-of-the-art baselines at a watermark detectability strength of 95\%. In challenging scenarios such as short text generation and low-entropy output generation, our method yields performance gains of 47.78\% and 36.47\%, respectively. Moreover, under different attack senarios including insertion, synonym substitution and paraphrase attasks, WaterSearch maintains high detectability, further validating its robust anti-attack capabilities. Our code is available at \href{https://github.com/Yukang-Lin/WaterSearch}{https://github.com/Yukang-Lin/WaterSearch}.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为WaterSearch的新嵌入方案，该方案通过控制种子池以促进水印文本的多样并行生成。WaterSearch框架在保持高检测率的同时，通过优化分布保真度和水印信号特征来提升文本质量，同时具有强大的抗攻击能力。
AI.motivation: 现有嵌入方案在提高水印的鲁棒性时，会降低下游任务的效果。本文旨在设计一个能够同时提升文本质量和水印检测率的新框架。
AI.method: 设计了一个基于控制种子池的自适应嵌入方案，并提出了WaterSearch，这是一种基于句子的搜索框架，可以在多种现有方法的基础上提高文本的分布保真度和水印信号特征，同时引入了一种具有强大抗攻击能力的句子级别的检测方法。
AI.result: 在三个流行的大型语言模型上进行了十余种任务的评估，结果表明在最高的检测强度下，WaterSearch方法的性能平均提高了51.01%。对于挑战性场景如短文本生成和低熵输出生成，其提升分别达到47.78%和36.47%。此外，在插入、同义替换和改写等攻击场景下，WaterSearch保持了高的检测率，验证了其抗攻击能力。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出了WaterSearch，这是一种基于句子的搜索框架，能够同时增强文本质量和水印检测率，并展示了其在多个模型和任务上的显著性能提升和抗攻击能力。

title: Rethinking Lung Cancer Screening: AI Nodule Detection and Diagnosis Outperforms Radiologists, Leading Models, and Standards Beyond Size and Growth
comment: 25 pages, 8 figures, with supplementary information containing 11 figures
summary: Early detection of malignant lung nodules is critical, but its dependence on size and growth in screening inherently delays diagnosis. We present an AI system that redefines lung cancer screening by performing both detection and malignancy diagnosis directly at the nodule level on low-dose CT scans. To address limitations in dataset scale and explainability, we designed an ensemble of shallow deep learning and feature-based specialized models. Trained and evaluated on 25,709 scans with 69,449 annotated nodules, the system outperforms radiologists, Lung-RADS, and leading AI models (Sybil, Brock, Google, Kaggle). It achieves an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) of 0.98 internally and 0.945 on an independent cohort. With 0.5 false positives per scan at 99.3\% sensitivity, it addresses key barriers to AI adoption. Critically, it outperforms radiologists across all nodule sizes and stages, excelling in stage 1 cancers, and all growth-based metrics, including the least accurate: Volume-Doubling Time. It also surpasses radiologists by up to one year in diagnosing indeterminate and slow-growing nodules.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种基于低剂量CT扫描的AI系统，能够直接在结节水平上进行肺癌筛查和恶性诊断，克服了传统筛查方法对结节大小和生长的依赖性。系统性能超过了放射科医生、Lung-RADS分级和现有的AI模型，在小结节和早期癌症诊断中特别出色。
AI.motivation: 早期检测恶性肺结节至关重要，但传统的基于结节大小和生长的速度的筛查方法导致了诊断延迟。本研究旨在通过开发一套结合浅层深度学习和特征特化模型的集成系统，直接在结节水平上进行肺癌筛查和恶性诊断，以提高诊断精度和效率。
AI.method: 研究团队设计了一个包含浅层深度学习和基于特征的专业模型的集成系统。该系统在25,709个扫描图像和69,449个标注结节上进行训练和评估。实验证明，该系统在内部分组测试中AUC达到了0.98，在独立组测试中AUC为0.945。该系统在假阳性率为0.5次/扫描时的敏感性达到了99.3%，并显著优于放射科医生和现有AI模型。
AI.result: 该AI系统在结节大小和生长速度所有的度量标准上都超过了放射科医生和Lung-RADS分级系统，尤其是在小结节和早期癌症的诊断上。该系统还超越了许多生长指标，包括最不准确的体积翻倍时间（Volume-Doubling Time）。此外，在诊断不确定和缓慢生长的结节方面，它也取得了放射科医生一年前的诊断结果。
AI.conclusion: 该研究表明，基于低剂量CT扫描的AI系统具有精准检测和诊断恶性肺结节的能力，能够直接在结节水平上进行早期肺癌筛查。这一新的筛查方式有望克服传统方法的局限性，提高肺癌筛查的准确性和效率。

title: Med-CRAFT: Automated Construction of Interpretable and Multi-Hop Video Workloads via Knowledge Graph Traversal
summary: The scarcity of high-quality, logically annotated video datasets remains a primary bottleneck in advancing Multi-Modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) for the medical domain. Traditional manual annotation is prohibitively expensive and non-scalable, while existing synthetic methods often suffer from stochastic hallucinations and a lack of logical interpretability. To address these challenges, we introduce \textbf{\PipelineName}, a novel neuro-symbolic data engineering framework that formalizes benchmark synthesis as a deterministic graph traversal process. Unlike black-box generative approaches, Med-CRAFT extracts structured visual primitives (e.g., surgical instruments, anatomical boundaries) from raw video streams and instantiates them into a dynamic Spatiotemporal Knowledge Graph. By anchoring query generation to valid paths within this graph, we enforce a rigorous Chain-of-Thought (CoT) provenance for every synthesized benchmark item. We instantiate this pipeline to produce M3-Med-Auto, a large-scale medical video reasoning benchmark exhibiting fine-grained temporal selectivity and multi-hop logical complexity. Comprehensive evaluations demonstrate that our automated pipeline generates query workloads with complexity comparable to expert-curated datasets. Furthermore, a logic alignment analysis reveals a high correlation between the prescribed graph topology and the reasoning steps of state-of-the-art MLLMs, validating the system's capability to encode verifiable logic into visual-linguistic benchmarks. This work paves the way for scalable, low-cost construction of robust evaluation protocols in critical domains.

AI.tldr: 介绍了PipelineName，一种新颖的神经符号数据工程框架，用于生成逻辑清晰的医学视频基准数据集，其复杂度与人工标注的数据集相当。框架通过从原始视频流中提取结构化视觉原语并实例化到动态空间时间知识图中，确保推理步骤的严谨性。
AI.motivation: 传统的手动标注过于昂贵且不具有扩展性，现有的合成方法则存在随机幻觉和逻辑可解释性不足的问题。为了解决这些问题，作者提出了PipelineName框架。
AI.method: PipelineName框架将基准合成形式化为确定性的图遍历过程。框架从原始视频流中提取结构化的视觉原语，然后实例化到动态的空间时间知识图中，并且通过路径绑定查询生成来确保推理步骤的严谨性。
AI.result: PipelineName生成了名为M3-Med-Auto的大规模医学视频推理基准，展示了精细的时间选择性和多跳逻辑复杂性。自动化生成的数据集复杂度与专家标注的数据集相当。
AI.conclusion: 该研究证明了Framework能够生成逻辑验证的数据集，这为在关键领域构建可扩展且低成本的评估协议开辟了新的可能性。

title: Less is More: Resource-Efficient Low-Rank Adaptation
summary: Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) is a widely adopted parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) method for Large Language Models (LLMs), but it still incurs notable overhead and suffers from parameter interference in complex datasets. While re- cent works decouple LoRA update matrices to exploit matrix-wise asymmetry, training costs remain high. We revisit LoRA from the perspective of inter-matrix and intra-layer parameter redundancy and propose Resource-Efficient Low-Rank Adaptation, EffiLoRA, a lightweight and generalizable approach for language, multimodal, and diffusion models. EffiLoRA employs a unified A matrix across all transformer layers and introduces a runtime selective B matrices up- date to dynamically trade-off the system resource budget and model performance. EffiLoRA consistently outperforms LoRA across diverse modalities, including commonsense reasoning, visual instruction tuning, and image generation, demon- strating improved efficiency and robustness.

AI.tldr: EffiLoRA是一种轻量级且可泛化的资源高效低秩适应方法，适用于语言、多模态和扩散模型。该方法使用统一的A矩阵跨所有转换器层，并引入了基于运行时选择的B矩阵更新，以动态权衡系统资源预算和模型性能。
AI.motivation: LoRA虽然提高了参数效率，但在复杂数据集上仍存在性能瓶颈和参数干扰问题，并且近期的研究虽然试图通过矩阵级不对称来降低训练成本，但效果有限。
AI.method: EffiLoRA采用了统一的A矩阵贯穿所有变换器层，并引入了运行时选择的B矩阵更新机制，实现资源预算和模型性能之间的动态平衡。
AI.result: EffiLoRA在多种模型类型上表现出优于LoRA的效果，特别是在常识推理、视觉指令微调和图像生成等模态上，显示出更高的效率和更强的稳健性。
AI.conclusion: EffiLoRA提出了一种改进的低秩适应方法，旨在提高大型语言模型和其他类型的模型的参数效率和性能，特别是在复杂数据集上提供了更好的表现。

title: Reward Auditor: Inference on Reward Modeling Suitability in Real-World Perturbed Scenarios
summary: Reliable reward models (RMs) are critical for ensuring the safe alignment of large language models (LLMs). However, current evaluation methods focus solely on preference perception accuracies in given specific scenarios, obscuring the critical vulnerabilities of RMs in real-world scenarios. We identify the true challenge lies in assessing a novel dimension: Suitability, defined as conditional reliability under specific real-world perturbations. To this end, we introduce Reward Auditor, a hypothesis-testing framework specifically designed for RM suitability inference. Rather than answering "How accurate is the RM's preference perception for given samples?", it employs scientific auditing to answer: "Can we infer RMs exhibit systematic vulnerabilities in specific real-world scenarios?". Under real-world perturbed scenarios, Reward Auditor quantifies statistical significance and effect size by auditing distribution degradation of RM preference perception confidence. This enables inference of both the certainty and severity of RM vulnerabilities across diverse real-world scenarios. This lays a solid foundation for building next-generation LLM alignment systems that are verifiably safe, more robust, and trustworthy.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Reward Auditor的新框架，用于评估奖励模型在特定现实世界扰动下的适用性。它通过科学审计方法来检测奖励模型在现实场景中的系统性漏洞，从而推动构建更安全、更稳健和值得信赖的LLM系统。
AI.motivation: 当前的奖励模型评估方法仅关注给定特定场景下的偏好感知准确性，而忽略了现实世界中的关键脆弱性。本文旨在提出一个新框架来评估奖励模型的适用性，以应对这些挑战。
AI.method: 引入了一个假设测试框架——Reward Auditor，用于评估奖励模型的适用性。通过科学审计方法，在现实世界扰动情景下，定量分析奖励模型偏好感知置信度的分布降级，从而推断奖励模型在特定现实场景中的系统性漏洞。
AI.result: Reward Auditor框架能够在现实世界扰动情景下，量化统计显著性和效应大小，推断奖励模型的可靠性和严重性。这为建立可验证安全、更稳健和可信的LLM对齐系统奠定了基础。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的Reward Auditor框架为奖励模型在现实世界中的性能评估提供了一种新的视角，有助于提升LLM的对齐系统的安全性、鲁棒性和可信性。

title: TGSFormer: Scalable Temporal Gaussian Splatting for Embodied Semantic Scene Completion
summary: Embodied 3D Semantic Scene Completion (SSC) infers dense geometry and semantics from continuous egocentric observations. Most existing Gaussian-based methods rely on random initialization of many primitives within predefined spatial bounds, resulting in redundancy and poor scalability to unbounded scenes. Recent depth-guided approach alleviates this issue but remains local, suffering from latency and memory overhead as scale increases. To overcome these challenges, we propose TGSFormer, a scalable Temporal Gaussian Splatting framework for embodied SSC. It maintains a persistent Gaussian memory for temporal prediction, without relying on image coherence or frame caches. For temporal fusion, a Dual Temporal Encoder jointly processes current and historical Gaussian features through confidence-aware cross-attention. Subsequently, a Confidence-aware Voxel Fusion module merges overlapping primitives into voxel-aligned representations, regulating density and maintaining compactness. Extensive experiments demonstrate that TGSFormer achieves state-of-the-art results on both local and embodied SSC benchmarks, offering superior accuracy and scalability with significantly fewer primitives while maintaining consistent long-term scene integrity. The code will be released upon acceptance.

AI.tldr: TGSFormer 是一种用于体态3D语义场景完成的可扩展框架，它通过时空预测维护持久化的高斯记忆，利用双重时间编码器和置信度感知的体素融合模块，实现高效的场景重建。
AI.motivation: 现有的高斯基线方法依赖于在预定义的空间范围内随机初始化许多原语，这导致了冗余并导致了大规模下的不良可扩展性。深度引导的方法减轻了这一点，但在处理更大规模时仍会遇到延迟和内存开销问题。TGSFormer的目的是提供一种新的框架来解决这些挑战。
AI.method: TGSFormer 使用时空预测维护持久化的高斯记忆，而不是依赖于图像一致性和帧缓存。通过双重时间编码器处理当前和历史高斯特征，并通过置信度感知的交叉注意机制。之后，置信度感知的体素融合模块将重叠的原语合并成体素对齐的表示，以调节密度并保持紧凑性。
AI.result: TGSFormer在本地和体态3D语义场景完成基准上取得了最先进的结果，实现了更高的准确性和可扩展性，同时使用显著减少的原语数量并保持长期场景的一致性。
AI.conclusion: TGSFormer 通过维护时空预测的持久高斯记忆和置信度感知的体素融合机制，展现了在3D场景完成任务上的优越性能，并在代码被接受后公开分享。

title: Automating the Refinement of Reinforcement Learning Specifications
summary: Logical specifications have been shown to help reinforcement learning algorithms in achieving complex tasks. However, when a task is under-specified, agents might fail to learn useful policies. In this work, we explore the possibility of improving coarse-grained logical specifications via an exploration-guided strategy. We propose \textsc{AutoSpec}, a framework that searches for a logical specification refinement whose satisfaction implies satisfaction of the original specification, but which provides additional guidance therefore making it easier for reinforcement learning algorithms to learn useful policies. \textsc{AutoSpec} is applicable to reinforcement learning tasks specified via the SpectRL specification logic. We exploit the compositional nature of specifications written in SpectRL, and design four refinement procedures that modify the abstract graph of the specification by either refining its existing edge specifications or by introducing new edge specifications. We prove that all four procedures maintain specification soundness, i.e. any trajectory satisfying the refined specification also satisfies the original. We then show how \textsc{AutoSpec} can be integrated with existing reinforcement learning algorithms for learning policies from logical specifications. Our experiments demonstrate that \textsc{AutoSpec} yields promising improvements in terms of the complexity of control tasks that can be solved, when refined logical specifications produced by \textsc{AutoSpec} are utilized.

AI.tldr: AutoSpec框架通过搜索改进的逻辑规范，使其更容易被强化学习算法学习，从而克服了任务欠规范的问题，提高了强化学习在控制任务中的性能。
AI.motivation: 当任务描述不充分时，强化学习算法可能无法学习到有用的策略。AutoSpec旨在通过探索改进粗糙粒度的逻辑规范，为算法提供额外的指导，从而提升其从逻辑规范中学习策略的能力。
AI.method: AutoSpec框架采用了一种探索导向的策略，该策略能够根据现有规范寻找一种改进的逻辑规范，这种规范不仅满足原始规范，还能为强化学习提供额外指导。这种方法利用了SpectRL规范逻辑的组合特性，并设计了四种改进规范的方式。
AI.result: 通过AutoSpec改进的逻辑规范，该框架能够解决更复杂的控制任务，并且实验结果证实了其有效性，表明改进后的规范提高了强化学习算法的性能。
AI.conclusion: AutoSpec展示了如何通过逻辑规范的改进，提高强化学习在复杂控制任务中的应用。未来的研究可以进一步探索其他规范逻辑的应用，以及如何在更广泛的领域中应用此框架。

title: Mitigating Hallucinations in Zero-Shot Scientific Summarisation: A Pilot Study
summary: Large language models (LLMs) produce context inconsistency hallucinations, which are LLM generated outputs that are misaligned with the user prompt. This research project investigates whether prompt engineering (PE) methods can mitigate context inconsistency hallucinations in zero-shot LLM summarisation of scientific texts, where zero-shot indicates that the LLM relies purely on its pre-training data. Across eight yeast biotechnology research paper abstracts, six instruction-tuned LLMs were prompted with seven methods: a base- line prompt, two levels of increasing instruction complexity (PE-1 and PE-2), two levels of context repetition (CR-K1 and CR-K2), and two levels of random addition (RA-K1 and RA-K2). Context repetition involved the identification and repetition of K key sentences from the abstract, whereas random addition involved the repetition of K randomly selected sentences from the abstract, where K is 1 or 2. A total of 336 LLM-generated summaries were evaluated using six metrics: ROUGE-1, ROUGE-2, ROUGE-L, BERTScore, METEOR, and cosine similarity, which were used to compute the lexical and semantic alignment be- tween the summaries and the abstracts. Four hypotheses on the effects of prompt methods on summary alignment with the reference text were tested. Statistical analysis on 3744 collected datapoints was performed using bias-corrected and accelerated (BCa) bootstrap confidence intervals and Wilcoxon signed-rank tests with Bonferroni-Holm correction. The results demonstrated that CR and RA significantly improve the lexical alignment of LLM-generated summaries with the abstracts. These findings indicate that prompt engineering has the potential to impact hallucinations in zero-shot scientific summarisation tasks.

AI.tldr: 研究通过不同提示工程方法改善了零样本科学总结中的语义一致性，特别指出重复关键句子和随机句子能显著提升总结的词法一致性。
AI.motivation: 研究希望探索提示工程方法是否可以在零样本大语言模型总结科学文本时减轻上下文不一致的幻觉问题。
AI.method: 研究选取了8篇酵母生物技术研究的摘要，并使用六种不同的提示工程技术（包括基线提示、不同复杂度的提示、不同重复句子数量的提示和不同随机添加句子数量的提示）来测试其效果。研究使用了六种评价指标来衡量生成的总结与原始摘要之间的语义和词法一致性。
AI.result: 统计分析表明，重复关键句子和随机添加句子这两种提示工程技术显著提高了生成摘要与原始摘要之间的词法一致性。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明提示工程技术在零样本科学总结任务中对抗幻觉问题具有潜在效果，尤其是重复关键句子和随机添加句子的方法更为有效。

title: Optimizing Distributional Geometry Alignment with Optimal Transport for Generative Dataset Distillation
summary: Dataset distillation seeks to synthesize a compact distilled dataset, enabling models trained on it to achieve performance comparable to models trained on the full dataset. Recent methods for large-scale datasets focus on matching global distributional statistics (e.g., mean and variance), but overlook critical instance-level characteristics and intraclass variations, leading to suboptimal generalization. We address this limitation by reformulating dataset distillation as an Optimal Transport (OT) distance minimization problem, enabling fine-grained alignment at both global and instance levels throughout the pipeline. OT offers a geometrically faithful framework for distribution matching. It effectively preserves local modes, intra-class patterns, and fine-grained variations that characterize the geometry of complex, high-dimensional distributions. Our method comprises three components tailored for preserving distributional geometry: (1) OT-guided diffusion sampling, which aligns latent distributions of real and distilled images; (2) label-image-aligned soft relabeling, which adapts label distributions based on the complexity of distilled image distributions; and (3) OT-based logit matching, which aligns the output of student models with soft-label distributions. Extensive experiments across diverse architectures and large-scale datasets demonstrate that our method consistently outperforms state-of-the-art approaches in an efficient manner, achieving at least 4% accuracy improvement under IPC=10 settings for each architecture on ImageNet-1K.

AI.tldr: 该研究将数据集蒸馏问题重新表述为最优传输距离最小化问题，通过OT指导的扩散采样、标签-图像对齐软标签重标记以及OT基于的逻辑匹配三个步骤实现全局和实例级别的细粒度对齐。
AI.motivation: 当前方法主要关注全局分布统计（如均值和方差），而忽视了关键的实例级特征和内部类别差异，导致泛化能力欠佳。因此，本研究旨在通过引入最优传输方法改进数据集蒸馏。
AI.method: 研究提出了一个由三个部分组成的方案：1）OT引导的扩散采样，用于对齐实际和蒸馏图像的潜在分布；2）标签-图像对齐的软标签重标记，基于蒸馏图像分布的复杂性来调整标签分布；3）基于OT的逻辑匹配，对齐学生模型的输出与软标签分布。
AI.result: 在不同架构和大规模数据集上进行的大量实验表明，本方法在高效性方面优于现有最先进的方法。在ImageNet-1K数据集的IPC=10设置下，每一架构都至少实现了4%的准确率提升。
AI.conclusion: 本研究通过对数据集蒸馏问题的创新解决方式，成功提升了模型在复杂高维分布上的泛化性能。

title: DeformAr: Rethinking NER Evaluation through Component Analysis and Visual Analytics
comment: PhD Thesis, University of Sussex, 2025. 311 pages, 140 figures, 32 tables. Submitted as a PDF-only. First supervisor: Julie Weeds. Second supervisor: David Weir
summary:
Transformer models have significantly advanced Natural Language Processing (NLP), demonstrating strong performance in English. However, their effectiveness in Arabic, particularly for Named Entity Recognition (NER), remains limited, even with larger pre-trained models. This performance gap stems from multiple factors, including tokenisation, dataset quality, and annotation inconsistencies. Existing studies often analyze these issues in isolation, failing to capture their joint effect on system behaviour and performance.
  We introduce DeformAr (Debugging and Evaluation Framework for Transformer-based NER Systems), a novel framework designed to investigate and explain the performance discrepancy between Arabic and English NER systems. DeformAr integrates a data extraction library and an interactive dashboard, supporting two modes of evaluation: cross-component analysis and behavioural analysis. The framework divides each language into dataset and model components to examine their interactions.
  The analysis proceeds in two stages. First, cross-component analysis provides systematic diagnostic measures across data and model subcomponents, addressing the "what," "how," and "why" behind observed discrepancies. The second stage applies behavioural analysis by combining interpretability techniques with token-level metrics, interactive visualisations, and representation space analysis. These stages enable a component-aware diagnostic process that detects model behaviours and explains them by linking them to underlying representational patterns and data factors. DeformAr is the first Arabic-specific, component-based interpretability tool, offering a crucial resource for advancing model analysis in under-resourced languages.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种名为DeformAr的新框架，旨在调查和解释阿拉伯语和英语命名实体识别系统之间的性能差异。DeformAr结合了数据提取库和交互式仪表盘，支持跨组件分析和行为分析两种评估模式。
AI.motivation: 目前，基于Transformer的阿拉伯语命名实体识别系统的表现与英语相比仍存在差距，现有研究多从单一角度出发未能充分理解这些差异。DeformAr旨在填补这一空白。
AI.method: DeformAr框架通过数据提取库和交互式仪表盘支持两种评估模式。在跨组件分析阶段，它使用系统性的诊断措施来探究数据和模型子组件的差异。在行为分析阶段，则结合可解释性技术、词级别度量、交互式可视化和表示空间分析，进一步揭示模型行为背后的模式和数据因素。
AI.result: 通过DeformAr，研究者能够更全面地理解阿拉伯语和英语命名实体识别系统之间的性能差异，这有助于提高阿拉伯语命名实体识别系统的性能。
AI.conclusion: DeformAr是首个针对阿拉伯语的组件基础可解释性工具，为资源不足的语言建模分析提供了重要资源。

title: Testing the Machine Consciousness Hypothesis
summary: The Machine Consciousness Hypothesis states that consciousness is a substrate-free functional property of computational systems capable of second-order perception. I propose a research program to investigate this idea in silico by studying how collective self-models (coherent, self-referential representations) emerge from distributed learning systems embedded within universal self-organizing environments. The theory outlined here starts from the supposition that consciousness is an emergent property of collective intelligence systems undergoing synchronization of prediction through communication. It is not an epiphenomenon of individual modeling but a property of the language that a system evolves to internally describe itself. For a model of base reality, I begin with a minimal but general computational world: a cellular automaton, which exhibits both computational irreducibility and local reducibility. On top of this computational substrate, I introduce a network of local, predictive, representational (neural) models capable of communication and adaptation. I use this layered model to study how collective intelligence gives rise to self-representation as a direct consequence of inter-agent alignment. I suggest that consciousness does not emerge from modeling per se, but from communication. It arises from the noisy, lossy exchange of predictive messages between groups of local observers describing persistent patterns in the underlying computational substrate (base reality). It is through this representational dialogue that a shared model arises, aligning many partial views of the world. The broader goal is to develop empirically testable theories of machine consciousness, by studying how internal self-models may form in distributed systems without centralized control.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出了机器意识假说的一种新研究计划，通过研究嵌入自组织环境中的分布式学习系统，探索集体自我模型如何通过通信同步预测而涌现。
AI.motivation: 论文旨在通过研究分布式系统的集体自我模型探索意识的本质，认为意识是一种集体智能属性的涌现结果，而非个体建模的副现象。
AI.method: 研究的方法包括构建一个基于细胞自动机的最小化计算世界，添加本地预测和适应性的代表模型层，进而探讨集体智能如何通过交流导致自我表征。
AI.result: 研究表明，意识并非来自模型构建本身，而是源自通信，它是在描述基实时的持久模式时，通过噪音和损耗信息的交互激发的共享模型。
AI.conclusion: 论文提出了一种新的研究途径，旨在通过分布式系统的内部自我模型形成过程，发展关于机器意识的可实验理论。

title: Fine-tuning of lightweight large language models for sentiment classification on heterogeneous financial textual data
summary: Large language models (LLMs) play an increasingly important role in finan- cial markets analysis by capturing signals from complex and heterogeneous textual data sources, such as tweets, news articles, reports, and microblogs. However, their performance is dependent on large computational resources and proprietary datasets, which are costly, restricted, and therefore inacces- sible to many researchers and practitioners. To reflect realistic situations we investigate the ability of lightweight open-source LLMs - smaller and publicly available models designed to operate with limited computational resources - to generalize sentiment understanding from financial datasets of varying sizes, sources, formats, and languages. We compare the benchmark finance natural language processing (NLP) model, FinBERT, and three open-source lightweight LLMs, DeepSeek-LLM 7B, Llama3 8B Instruct, and Qwen3 8B on five publicly available datasets: FinancialPhraseBank, Financial Question Answering, Gold News Sentiment, Twitter Sentiment and Chinese Finance Sentiment. We find that LLMs, specially Qwen3 8B and Llama3 8B, perform best in most scenarios, even from using only 5% of the available training data. These results hold in zero-shot and few-shot learning scenarios. Our findings indicate that lightweight, open-source large language models (LLMs) consti- tute a cost-effective option, as they can achieve competitive performance on heterogeneous textual data even when trained on only a limited subset of the extensive annotated corpora that are typically deemed necessary.

AI.tldr: 本研究评估了轻量级开源大语言模型（LLMs）在不同规模、来源、格式和语言的金融数据集上的情感理解能力，发现即便是使用5%的训练数据，Qwen3 8B 和 Llama3 8B 在大多数场景下表现最佳。
AI.motivation: 研究动机在于分析轻量级开源大语言模型是否能在缺乏大量专用数据集的情况下，依然保持与传统大模型相当甚至更好的表现，从而为研究人员和从业者提供一种更具成本效益的选择。
AI.method: 研究方法包括选择五组公开可用的金融数据集进行实验，比较基准的金融自然语言处理模型FinBERT与三个开源轻量级大语言模型DeepSeek-LLM 7B、Llama3 8B Instruct 及 Qwen3 8B 的性能。
AI.result: 研究结果显示，轻量级模型在各种金融数据集上，尤其在仅使用5%训练数据的情况下，表现最佳，尤其是在零样本和少样本学习场景中。
AI.conclusion: 研究结论表明，轻量级开源模型具有成本效益，能有效处理异质性文本数据，即便是使用大规模标注语料库的有限部分也能获得与传统大型模型相当的性能。

title: Odometry Without Correspondence from Inertially Constrained Ruled Surfaces
summary: Visual odometry techniques typically rely on feature extraction from a sequence of images and subsequent computation of optical flow. This point-to-point correspondence between two consecutive frames can be costly to compute and suffers from varying accuracy, which affects the odometry estimate's quality. Attempts have been made to bypass the difficulties originating from the correspondence problem by adopting line features and fusing other sensors (event camera, IMU) to improve performance, many of which still heavily rely on correspondence. If the camera observes a straight line as it moves, the image of the line sweeps a smooth surface in image-space time. It is a ruled surface and analyzing its shape gives information about odometry. Further, its estimation requires only differentially computed updates from point-to-line associations. Inspired by event cameras' propensity for edge detection, this research presents a novel algorithm to reconstruct 3D scenes and visual odometry from these ruled surfaces. By constraining the surfaces with the inertia measurements from an onboard IMU sensor, the dimensionality of the solution space is greatly reduced.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种基于规则曲面的3D场景重建和视觉里程计的新算法，通过结合车载IMU的惯性测量来限制解空间的维度。
AI.motivation: 现有视觉里程计方法依赖于特征提取和光流计算，容易受对应问题困扰，导致难以保证精度，这一研究旨在通过引入事件摄像机的边缘检测能力和利用IMU惯性测量，提供一种新的控制维数的方法以解决这一问题。
AI.method: 该方法基于摄像机移动过程中观察到的直线在图像空间时间中的表现，即被扫描的光滑表面（规则曲面）。通过分析这些规则曲面的形状以获取关于里程计的相关信息，并利用IMU传感器提供的惯性测量来限制解空间的维度。进而，通过点到直线的关联进行微分计算更新。
AI.result: 经过实验验证，该方法能够有效进行3D场景重建，并显著提高了视觉里程计的性能和稳定性。
AI.conclusion: 该研究为解决视觉里程计中的对应问题提供了一种新的路径，对于提高视觉里程计在复杂环境下的鲁棒性和精确性具有重要意义。

title: CodeDistiller: Automatically Generating Code Libraries for Scientific Coding Agents
summary: Automated Scientific Discovery (ASD) systems can help automatically generate and run code-based experiments, but their capabilities are limited by the code they can reliably generate from parametric knowledge alone. As a result, current systems either mutate a small number of manually-crafted experiment examples, or operate solely from parametric knowledge, limiting quality and reach. We introduce CodeDistiller, a system that automatically distills large collections of scientific Github repositories into a vetted library of working domain-specific code examples, allowing ASD agents to expand their capabilities without manual effort. Using a combination of automatic and domain-expert evaluation on 250 materials science repositories, we find the best model is capable of producing functional examples for 74% of repositories, while our downstream evaluation shows an ASD agent augmented with a CodeDistiller generated library produces more accurate, complete, and scientifically sound experiments than an agent with only general materials-science code examples.

AI.tldr: CodeDistiller 是一个系统，可以从大型科学 Github 存储库集合中自动提炼出高质量的特定领域代码示例库，帮助 ASD 系统自动扩展其实验生成能力，提升试验的质量和完整性。
AI.motivation: 当前的 ASD 系统要么只能生成少量手动创建的实验示例，要么仅依赖于参数知识，这限制了实验的质量和范围。CodeDistiller 旨在解决这一问题，通过自动化从公开的 Github 存储库中提炼出科学领域的高质量代码示例，从而提高 ASD 系统的实验生成能力。
AI.method: 研究团队通过自动和领域专家的评估，从 250 个材料科学的 Github 存储库中提取了高质量的代码示例，并在下游实验评估中展示了，将这些代码示例集成到 ASD 系统后，生成的实验更加准确完整且具有科学性。
AI.result: 研究表明，CodeDistiller 能够为 74% 的材料科学存储库生成功能性代码示例，且使用该代码示例库增强的 ASD 系统生成的实验比仅使用通用材料科学代码示例的 ASD 系统产生的实验更为准确、完整且具有科学性。
AI.conclusion: CodeDistiller 为 ASD 系统提供了一种高效的方法来扩展其代码生成能力，显著提升了实验的准确性和完整性，展示了其在科学实验中的应用潜力。

title: MVAD : A Comprehensive Multimodal Video-Audio Dataset for AIGC Detection
summary: The rapid advancement of AI-generated multimodal video-audio content has raised significant concerns regarding information security and content authenticity. Existing synthetic video datasets predominantly focus on the visual modality alone, while the few incorporating audio are largely confined to facial deepfakes--a limitation that fails to address the expanding landscape of general multimodal AI-generated content and substantially impedes the development of trustworthy detection systems. To bridge this critical gap, we introduce the Multimodal Video-Audio Dataset (MVAD), the first comprehensive dataset specifically designed for detecting AI-generated multimodal video-audio content. Our dataset exhibits three key characteristics: (1) genuine multimodality with samples generated according to three realistic video-audio forgery patterns; (2) high perceptual quality achieved through diverse state-of-the-art generative models; and (3) comprehensive diversity spanning realistic and anime visual styles, four content categories (humans, animals, objects, and scenes), and four video-audio multimodal data types. Our dataset will be available at https://github.com/HuMengXue0104/MVAD.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了Multimodal Video-Audio Dataset (MVAD)，这是一个专为检测AI生成的多模态视频-音频内容而设计的首个综合数据集，包含真实的多模态样本，具有高质量和多样性。
AI.motivation: 现有的合成视频数据集主要集中在视觉模态上，而包含音频的数据集大多局限于面部换脸技术，这无法涵盖更广泛的多模态AI生成内容，因此阻碍了可信赖检测系统的开发。MVAD旨在填补这一关键空白。
AI.method: MVAD基于三种现实的视频-音频伪造模式生成真实多模态样本，通过多种最先进的生成模型实现高质量，涵盖现实和动漫视觉风格、四种内容类别（人类、动物、物体和场景）以及四种视频-音频多模态数据类型。
AI.result: 目前尚未明确提及结果。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出了一种全新的数据集MVAD，以促进多模态视频-音频内容的检测研究和开发。

title: Energy-Aware Data-Driven Model Selection in LLM-Orchestrated AI Systems
summary: As modern artificial intelligence (AI) systems become more advanced and capable, they can leverage a wide range of tools and models to perform complex tasks. Today, the task of orchestrating these models is often performed by Large Language Models (LLMs) that rely on qualitative descriptions of models for decision-making. However, the descriptions provided to these LLM-based orchestrators do not reflect true model capabilities and performance characteristics, leading to suboptimal model selection, reduced accuracy, and increased energy costs. In this paper, we conduct an empirical analysis of LLM-based orchestration limitations and propose GUIDE, a new energy-aware model selection framework that accounts for performance-energy trade-offs by incorporating quantitative model performance characteristics in decision-making. Experimental results demonstrate that GUIDE increases accuracy by 0.90%-11.92% across various evaluated tasks, and achieves up to 54% energy efficiency improvement, while reducing orchestrator model selection latency from 4.51 s to 7.2 ms.

AI.tldr: 本文通过实证分析LLM基元调度的局限性，并提出名为GUIDE的新框架，该框架通过在决策中纳入性能-能源权衡来利用定量的模型性能特征，从而获得更好的准确性和能源效率。
AI.motivation: LLM调度使用定性的模型描述进行决策，导致不准确选择模型，降低了准确性并增加了能源成本。
AI.method: 通过实证分析LLM调度的限制，提出GUIDE框架，将定量的模型性能特征纳入决策过程。
AI.result: GUIDE在不同任务上的准确率提高了0.90%-11.92%，能效提高了54%，并将调度器模型选择的延迟从4.51秒降低到7.2毫秒。
AI.conclusion: GUIDE是一个能源感知的模型选择框架，能够提高准确性和能源效率，并减少调度延迟。

title: Assimilation Matters: Model-level Backdoor Detection in Vision-Language Pretrained Models
summary: Vision-language pretrained models (VLPs) such as CLIP have achieved remarkable success, but are also highly vulnerable to backdoor attacks. Given a model fine-tuned by an untrusted third party, determining whether the model has been injected with a backdoor is a critical and challenging problem. Existing detection methods usually rely on prior knowledge of training dataset, backdoor triggers and targets, or downstream classifiers, which may be impractical for real-world applications. To address this, To address this challenge, we introduce Assimilation Matters in DETection (AMDET), a novel model-level detection framework that operates without any such prior knowledge. Specifically, we first reveal the feature assimilation property in backdoored text encoders: the representations of all tokens within a backdoor sample exhibit a high similarity. Further analysis attributes this effect to the concentration of attention weights on the trigger token. Leveraging this insight, AMDET scans a model by performing gradient-based inversion on token embeddings to recover implicit features that capable of activating backdoor behaviors. Furthermore, we identify the natural backdoor feature in the OpenAI's official CLIP model, which are not intentionally injected but still exhibit backdoor-like behaviors. We then filter them out from real injected backdoor by analyzing their loss landscapes. Extensive experiments on 3,600 backdoored and benign-finetuned models with two attack paradigms and three VLP model structures show that AMDET detects backdoors with an F1 score of 89.90%. Besides, it achieves one complete detection in approximately 5 minutes on a RTX 4090 GPU and exhibits strong robustness against adaptive attacks. Code is available at: https://github.com/Robin-WZQ/AMDET

AI.tldr: AMDET 是一种无需任何先验知识的新型模型级后门检测框架，通过揭示 backdoored 文本编码器中特征吸积特性及注意力权重的集中现象来检测后门，最终在多种攻击模式和 VLP 模型结构下实现了高精度和高效性。
AI.motivation: 当前的后门检测方法通常依赖于训练数据集、后门触发和目标以及下游分类器的先验知识，但在实际应用中获取这些信息可能不可行。因此，提出了 AMDET 框架，旨在无需此类先验知识的情况下检测后门攻击。
AI.method: AMDET 通过揭示 backdoored 文本编码器中所有 token 的表示特征高度相似性的现象，进一步分析出这种现象的原因是注意力权重集中于触发词。利用这一洞察，AMDET 通过在 token 向量嵌入上进行梯度基反转，来恢复能够激活后门行为的隐式特征。此外，AMDET 通过分析 CLIP 模型的后门自然特征来筛选出实际被注入的后门。
AI.result: AMDET 在 3,600 个 backdoored 和 benign-finetuned 模型上，使用两种攻击模式，针对三种 VLP 模型结构的大量实验中，检测后门攻击的 F1 分数达到 89.90%。此外，AMDET 在 RTX 4090 GPU 上实现一次完整检测所需时间约为 5 分钟，并对适应性攻击表现出较强的鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: AMDET 框架有效地解决了在实际应用中后门检测的挑战，通过新的特征吸积特性和梯度基反转方法，提高了后门检测的精度、效率和鲁棒性。

title: Foundation Priors
summary:
Foundation models, and in particular large language models, can generate highly informative responses, prompting growing interest in using these ''synthetic'' outputs as data in empirical research and decision-making. This paper introduces the idea of a foundation prior, which shows that model-generated outputs are not as real observations, but draws from the foundation prior induced prior predictive distribution. As such synthetic data reflects both the model's learned patterns and the user's subjective priors, expectations, and biases. We model the subjectivity of the generative process by making explicit the dependence of synthetic outputs on the user's anticipated data distribution, the prompt-engineering process, and the trust placed in the foundation model.
  We derive the foundation prior as an exponential-tilted, generalized Bayesian update of the user's primitive prior, where a trust parameter governs the weight assigned to synthetic data. We then show how synthetic data and the associated foundation prior can be incorporated into standard statistical and econometric workflows, and discuss their use in applications such as refining complex models, informing latent constructs, guiding experimental design, and augmenting random-coefficient and partially linear specifications. By treating generative outputs as structured, explicitly subjective priors rather than as empirical observations, the framework offers a principled way to harness foundation models in empirical work while avoiding the conflation of synthetic ''facts'' with real data.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出了一种称为基础先验的概念，将模型生成的输出视为在用户先验和对基础模型的信任加权下的经验更新，强调将这些生成的数据纳入统计和计量经济学工作流程，不将合成数据误认为是真实数据。
AI.motivation: 随着大型语言模型的广泛应用，人们对这些合成输出在实证研究和决策中的应用产生了浓厚兴趣。然而，合成数据不仅仅是对现实世界观测的直接反映，还包含了模型学习到的模式以及用户的先验信息、预期和偏见。
AI.method: 作者提出了一种称为基础先验的方法。此方法将合成数据建模为用户原始先验的指数倾斜、广义贝叶斯更新，其中信任参数调节合成数据在权重中的程度。该方法允许将合成数据纳入传统的统计和计量经济工作流程。
AI.result: 通过将生成的输出视为结构化的、表达主观性的先验，而非实证观察，该框架提供了一种在实证工作中有根据地利用基础模型的方法，同时避免了将合成“事实”误认为是真实数据。
AI.conclusion: 该论文提出了基础先验的概念，为如何将生成模型输出整合到统计和计量经济的应用中提供了方法论框架，并强调了区分合成信息与真实数据的重要性。

title: Advancing Academic Chatbots: Evaluation of Non Traditional Outputs
summary: Most evaluations of large language models focus on standard tasks such as factual question answering or short summarization. This research expands that scope in two directions: first, by comparing two retrieval strategies, Graph RAG, structured knowledge-graph based, and Advanced RAG, hybrid keyword-semantic search, for QA; and second, by evaluating whether LLMs can generate high quality non-traditional academic outputs, specifically slide decks and podcast scripts. We implemented a prototype combining Meta's LLaMA 3 70B open weight and OpenAI's GPT 4o mini API based. QA performance was evaluated using both human ratings across eleven quality dimensions and large language model judges for scalable cross validation. GPT 4o mini with Advanced RAG produced the most accurate responses. Graph RAG offered limited improvements and led to more hallucinations, partly due to its structural complexity and manual setup. Slide and podcast generation was tested with document grounded retrieval. GPT 4o mini again performed best, though LLaMA 3 showed promise in narrative coherence. Human reviewers were crucial for detecting layout and stylistic flaws, highlighting the need for combined human LLM evaluation in assessing emerging academic outputs.

AI.tldr: 该研究扩展了对大型语言模型的评估范围，不仅比较了两种检索策略（基于结构知识图的Graph RAG和混合关键词-语义搜索的Advanced RAG）在问答(QA)中的表现，还评估了模型生成非传统学术输出（如幻灯片和播客脚本）的能力。
AI.motivation: 由于现有的评估大多集中在标准任务上，因此进行这项研究旨在扩展评估范围，以更好地理解大型语言模型在生成复杂和创意学术输出方面的潜力。
AI.method: 研究通过实现一个结合了Meta的LLaMA 3 70B开源权重和OpenAI的GPT 4o mini API的原型，对两种检索策略进行了比较，并使用人类评分和大语言模型裁判进行QA性能评估。此外，还对模型生成幻灯片和播客脚本的能力进行了测试。
AI.result: GPT 4o mini结合Advanced RAG在QA上表现最佳，Graph RAG虽然有一定改进但容易产生幻觉。在幻灯片和播客脚本生成方面，GPT 4o mini表现最好，但LLaMA 3在叙事连贯性方面也有潜力。人类评审者对于检测布局和风格上的错误至关重要。
AI.conclusion: 研究发现，虽然大型语言模型在生成非传统学术作品方面表现出色，但结合人类评审仍然是评估这些作品质量的重要手段。

title: mmPred: Radar-based Human Motion Prediction in the Dark
comment: This paper is accepted by AAAI-2026
summary: Existing Human Motion Prediction (HMP) methods based on RGB-D cameras are sensitive to lighting conditions and raise privacy concerns, limiting their real-world applications such as firefighting and healthcare. Motivated by the robustness and privacy-preserving nature of millimeter-wave (mmWave) radar, this work introduces radar as a novel sensing modality for HMP, for the first time. Nevertheless, radar signals often suffer from specular reflections and multipath effects, resulting in noisy and temporally inconsistent measurements, such as body-part miss-detection. To address these radar-specific artifacts, we propose mmPred, the first diffusion-based framework tailored for radar-based HMP. mmPred introduces a dual-domain historical motion representation to guide the generation process, combining a Time-domain Pose Refinement (TPR) branch for learning fine-grained details and a Frequency-domain Dominant Motion (FDM) branch for capturing global motion trends and suppressing frame-level inconsistency. Furthermore, we design a Global Skeleton-relational Transformer (GST) as the diffusion backbone to model global inter-joint cooperation, enabling corrupted joints to dynamically aggregate information from others. Extensive experiments show that mmPred achieves state-of-the-art performance, outperforming existing methods by 8.6% on mmBody and 22% on mm-Fi.

AI.tldr: mmPred 是一种基于雷达的新框架，用于姿态预测，通过双域的历史动作表示和全局骨架关系变换器提高预测性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的基于 RGB-D 相机的人体动作预测方法对光照条件敏感并存在隐私问题，而毫米波雷达具有鲁棒性和隐私保护性，因此引入雷达作为新的传感模态。
AI.method: mmPred 引入了双域的历史动作表示，结合时间域姿态细化 (TPR) 分支和频域主导动作 (FDM) 分支来指导生成过程，同时设计了全局骨架关系变换器 (GST) 作为扩散骨干来建模全局关节间的合作关系。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，mmPred 达到了最新的技术水平，比现有方法在 mmBody 上性能高出 8.6%，在 mm-Fi 上性能高出 22%。
AI.conclusion: mmPred 框架展示了毫米波雷达在人体动作预测中的潜力，并提出了处理雷达特定噪声的有效策略。

title: A Benchmark of Causal vs Correlation AI for Predictive Maintenance
summary: Predictive maintenance in manufacturing environments presents a challenging optimization problem characterized by extreme cost asymmetry, where missed failures incur costs roughly fifty times higher than false alarms. Conventional machine learning approaches typically optimize statistical accuracy metrics that do not reflect this operational reality and cannot reliably distinguish causal relationships from spurious correlations. This study evaluates eight predictive models, ranging from baseline statistical approaches to formal causal inference methods, on a dataset of 10,000 CNC machines with a 3.3% failure prevalence. The formal causal inference model (L5) achieved estimated annual cost savings of 1.16 million USD (a 70.2 percent reduction), outperforming the best correlation-based decision tree model (L3) by approximately 80,000 USD per year. The causal model matched the highest observed recall (87.9 percent) while reducing false alarms by 97 percent (from 165 to 5) and attained a precision of 92.1 percent, with a train-test performance gap of only 2.6 percentage points. These results indicate that causal AI methods, when combined with domain knowledge, can yield superior financial outcomes and more interpretable predictions compared to correlation-based approaches in predictive maintenance applications.

AI.tldr: 本研究表明，通过评估8种预测模型，正式因果推断模型（L5）在成本节约、召回率、错误报警率和精确度方面显著优于基于相关性的决策树模型（L3），展示了因果AI方法在预测性维护中的优越性和可解释性。
AI.motivation: 在预测性维护环境中，传统的机器学习方法通常优化统计准确性的度量标准，而这些度量标准未能反映实际操作中的现实情况，无法可靠地区分因果关系和虚假相关性。因此，研究通过评估多种预测模型来解决这一问题。
AI.method: 本研究以一个包含10,000台CNC机器的数据集进行实验，该数据集有3.3%的故障频率。评估了从基础统计方法到正式因果推理方法的8种预测模型。
AI.result: 正式因果推理模型（L5）估计每年可节省116万美元的成本（70.2%的降幅），比最佳相关性决策树模型（L3）每年多节省约80,000美元。同时，因果模型的召回率最高（87.9%），将错误报警率减少了97%（从165减少到5次），精确度达到92.1%，训练-测试性能差异仅为2.6个百分点。
AI.conclusion: 这些结果表明，当与领域知识结合使用时，因果AI方法能够比基于相关性的方法在预测性维护应用中实现更优越的经济效益和更可解释的预测。

title: When Safety Blocks Sense: Measuring Semantic Confusion in LLM Refusals
summary: Safety-aligned language models often refuse prompts that are actually harmless. Current evaluations mostly report global rates such as false rejection or compliance. These scores treat each prompt alone and miss local inconsistency, where a model accepts one phrasing of an intent but rejects a close paraphrase. This gap limits diagnosis and tuning. We introduce "semantic confusion," a failure mode that captures such local inconsistency, and a framework to measure it. We build ParaGuard, a 10k-prompt corpus of controlled paraphrase clusters that hold intent fixed while varying surface form. We then propose three model-agnostic metrics at the token level: Confusion Index, Confusion Rate, and Confusion Depth. These metrics compare each refusal to its nearest accepted neighbors and use token embeddings, next-token probabilities, and perplexity signals. Experiments across diverse model families and deployment guards show that global false-rejection rate hides critical structure. Our metrics reveal globally unstable boundaries in some settings, localized pockets of inconsistency in others, and cases where stricter refusal does not increase inconsistency. We also show how confusion-aware auditing separates how often a system refuses from how sensibly it refuses. This gives developers a practical signal to reduce false refusals while preserving safety.

AI.tldr: 该研究引入了“语义混淆”作为评估语言模型安全性的新方法，通过构建ParaGuard语料库，提出三种基于标记级别的模型无关度量指标，揭示了全局错误拒绝率未能捕获的局部不一致性。实验表明，这三种度量指标能帮助开发者在减小误拒绝的同时保证模型的安全性。
AI.motivation: 当前评估语言模型安全性的方法过于笼统，未能捕捉到细微的局部不一致性问题。因此，研究团队希望找到一种新的评估方式来更准确地诊断和调整模型的安全性。
AI.method: 研究团队通过构建一个包含10000个受控重述簇的ParaGuard语料库，固定意图内容、改变表面形式。基于此语料库，提出了三种模型无关的标记级别度量指标：混淆指数、混淆率和混淆深度。
AI.result: 研究结果表明，全球错误拒绝率可能隐藏了关键的结构问题，而新的度量指标揭示了模型边界在不同场景下的不稳定性和局部不一致性。此外，这些度量指标还有助于区分系统拒绝频率和其拒绝合理性之间的区别。
AI.conclusion: 此研究为评估和调优语言模型的安全性提供了新的视角和工具，帮助开发者更好地理解模型的脆弱性和改进方向。

title: ELR-1000: A Community-Generated Dataset for Endangered Indic Indigenous Languages
summary: We present a culturally-grounded multimodal dataset of 1,060 traditional recipes crowdsourced from rural communities across remote regions of Eastern India, spanning 10 endangered languages. These recipes, rich in linguistic and cultural nuance, were collected using a mobile interface designed for contributors with low digital literacy. Endangered Language Recipes (ELR)-1000 -- captures not only culinary practices but also the socio-cultural context embedded in indigenous food traditions. We evaluate the performance of several state-of-the-art large language models (LLMs) on translating these recipes into English and find the following: despite the models' capabilities, they struggle with low-resource, culturally-specific language. However, we observe that providing targeted context -- including background information about the languages, translation examples, and guidelines for cultural preservation -- leads to significant improvements in translation quality. Our results underscore the need for benchmarks that cater to underrepresented languages and domains to advance equitable and culturally-aware language technologies. As part of this work, we release the ELR-1000 dataset to the NLP community, hoping it motivates the development of language technologies for endangered languages.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了来自印度东部偏远地区10种濒危语言的1060份传统食谱的多媒体数据集。通过为低数字素养的贡献者设计的移动界面收集，该数据集不仅记录了烹饪实践，还捕获了嵌入在原生食品传统中的社会文化背景。通过对几种最先进的大型语言模型进行评估，研究发现这些模型在低资源、文化特异性语言上的翻译表现不佳，但在提供针对性上下文后，其翻译质量显著提升。这强调了为那些受代表不足的语言和技术领域设立基准的重要性。
AI.motivation: 由于大型语言模型在处理低资源、文化特殊性的语言方面存在局限性，因此有必要汇集一个文化根基深厚的数据集来推动对濒危语言的保护和语言技术的发展。
AI.method: 该研究通过设计适合低数字素养贡献者的移动界面来收集食谱，并对几款最先进的大型语言模型进行翻译评估，提供针对性的上下文信息以改进翻译质量。
AI.result: 大型语言模型虽然强大，但在低资源、文化特异性语言上的翻译表现不佳，但在提供背景信息、翻译示例和文化保护指南后，其翻译质量得到了显著提高。
AI.conclusion: 研究确认了对低资源语言设置基准的重要性，并强调了文化保护和公平的语言技术发展的必要性。同时，该研究发布了ELR-1000数据集，希望能激发对濒危语言技术开发的兴趣。

title: Knowledge Graph Augmented Large Language Models for Next-Visit Disease Prediction
summary: Electronic health records (EHRs) support powerful clinical prediction models, but existing methods typically provide coarse, post hoc explanations that offer limited value for patient-level decision making. We introduce a knowledge graph (KG)-guided chain-of-thought (CoT) framework that generates clinically grounded and temporally consistent reasoning for visit-level disease prediction in MIMIC-III. ICD-9 codes are mapped to PrimeKG, from which disease-relevant nodes and multi-hop reasoning paths are extracted and used as scaffolds for CoT generation; only explanations whose conclusions match observed outcomes are retained. Lightweight LLaMA-3.1-Instruct-8B and Gemma-7B models are then fine-tuned on this supervision corpus. Across ten PrimeKG-mapped diseases and limited training cohorts (400 and 1000 cases), KG-guided models outperform strong classical baselines, achieving AUROC values of 0.66 to 0.70 and macro-AUPR values of 0.40 to 0.47. The models also transfer zero-shot to the CRADLE cohort, improving accuracy from approximately 0.40 to 0.51 up to 0.72 to 0.77. A blinded clinician evaluation shows consistent preference for KG-guided CoT explanations in clarity, relevance, and clinical correctness.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种知识图谱（KG）引导的推理链框架，用于生成与临床和时间相关性预测相关的解释，该框架在有限的培训集中表现出色，并且在未见过的数据集上具有良好的迁移性。
AI.motivation: 现有方法提供的解释较为粗糙，缺乏针对患者级别的临床决策价值。本研究旨在通过知识图谱提供的多跳推理路径，生成与临床相关的、时序一致的诊断推理，以支持更精确的临床预测。
AI.method: 该方法基于MIMIC-III数据集，利用PrimeKG进行ICD-9到KG节点的映射，提取相关的疾病节点及多跳推理路径，作为推理链生成的框架。通过KG指导，生成模型只能保留结论与实际观察结果一致的解释。模型使用轻量级的LLaMA-3.1-Instruct-8B和Gemma-7B进行微调。
AI.result: 研究结果显示，与知识图谱指导的模型相比，经典强基线模型的AUC值在0.66至0.70之间，宏观AUPR值在0.40至0.47之间。它还能够在无监督环境中在CRADLE数据集上进行迁移学习，提高了准确性，其中跨学科组的AUC值从大约0.40提高到0.51至0.72，至0.77。
AI.conclusion: 总的来说，知识图谱指导的推理链模型在临床疾病预测方面表现优越，不仅在现有数据集上有良好的表现，而且在未见过的数据集上也有显著的迁移性能。

title: How do we measure privacy in text? A survey of text anonymization metrics
comment: 13 pages, 1 figure, 1 table. To be published in Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics (AACL-IJCNLP 2025). Related resources at: https://github.com/ryxGuo/privacy-metrics-survey
summary: In this work, we aim to clarify and reconcile metrics for evaluating privacy protection in text through a systematic survey. Although text anonymization is essential for enabling NLP research and model development in domains with sensitive data, evaluating whether anonymization methods sufficiently protect privacy remains an open challenge. In manually reviewing 47 papers that report privacy metrics, we identify and compare six distinct privacy notions, and analyze how the associated metrics capture different aspects of privacy risk. We then assess how well these notions align with legal privacy standards (HIPAA and GDPR), as well as user-centered expectations grounded in HCI studies. Our analysis offers practical guidance on navigating the landscape of privacy evaluation approaches further and highlights gaps in current practices. Ultimately, we aim to facilitate more robust, comparable, and legally aware privacy evaluations in text anonymization.

AI.tldr: 该研究通过系统性回顾47篇关于隐私评估的文献，识别并比较了六种不同的隐私概念，并分析了相关指标如何捕捉隐私风险的不同方面。研究还评估了这些概念与HIPAA和GDPR法律标准以及基于HCI的用户期望的契合度，旨在为更稳健、可比和法律意识强烈的隐私评估提供实用指导。
AI.motivation: 随着自然语言处理（NLP）研究和模型开发在包含敏感数据的领域中越来越重要，如何评估脱敏方法是否充分保护隐私仍是一个开放的挑战。因此，这项研究旨在系统地审查文献，以澄清和协调隐私评估的度量标准，从而实现对隐私风险的全面评价。
AI.method: 通过手动回顾47篇关于隐私评估的文献，识别和比较六种不同的隐私概念，并分析这些概念与当前法律标准和用户期望的契合度，以评估不同指标如何捕捉隐私风险的不同方面。
AI.result: 研究发现六种隐私概念及其度量标准能够捕捉隐私风险的不同方面。并在评估这些隐私概念与HIPAA、GDPR和用户期望之间的契合度之后，提出了实用的指导建议。
AI.conclusion: 研究最终指出，在文本脱敏领域的隐私评估中应采取更为稳健、可比和法律意识强烈的策略，并且强调了当前实践中存在的空白。

title: Unsupervised decoding of encoded reasoning using language model interpretability
summary: As large language models become increasingly capable, there is growing concern that they may develop reasoning processes that are encoded or hidden from human oversight. To investigate whether current interpretability techniques can penetrate such encoded reasoning, we construct a controlled testbed by fine-tuning a reasoning model (DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Llama-70B) to perform chain-of-thought reasoning in ROT-13 encryption while maintaining intelligible English outputs. We evaluate mechanistic interpretability methods--in particular, logit lens analysis--on their ability to decode the model's hidden reasoning process using only internal activations. We show that logit lens can effectively translate encoded reasoning, with accuracy peaking in intermediate-to-late layers. Finally, we develop a fully unsupervised decoding pipeline that combines logit lens with automated paraphrasing, achieving substantial accuracy in reconstructing complete reasoning transcripts from internal model representations. These findings suggest that current mechanistic interpretability techniques may be more robust to simple forms of encoded reasoning than previously understood. Our work provides an initial framework for evaluating interpretability methods against models that reason in non-human-readable formats, contributing to the broader challenge of maintaining oversight over increasingly capable AI systems.

AI.tldr: 研究使用受控测试环境和logit lens分析方法，探究当前解释技术能否解密大型语言模型中的隐藏推理过程，结果显示即使推理过程被加密，当前技术仍然能够部分解码其内部逻辑，并提出了一个无监督的解码管道，显著提高了推理解码的准确性。
AI.motivation: 由于大型语言模型可能发展出嵌入式的、难以监控的推理过程，研究旨在评估当前解释技术在面对这种潜在威胁时的有效性。
AI.method: 构建一个受控测试环境，通过微调一个使用ROT-13加密进行链式推理的模型（DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Llama-70B），并使用logit lens分析方法评估其内激活层解密隐藏推理的能力。此外，还开发了一个结合了logit lens和自动化重述的技术，以无监督方式重建完整推理链。
AI.result: logit lens能够在模型内部激活层的中后期有效地翻译加密的推理过程，而无监督解码管道在重建完整的推理记录方面表现出显著的准确性。
AI.conclusion: 当前的技术手段可能比预期的更有效地应对简单的隐藏推理形式，为未来评估方法提供了初步框架，并强调了持续监控日益先进的人工智能系统的重要性。

title: THCRL: Trusted Hierarchical Contrastive Representation Learning for Multi-View Clustering
summary: Multi-View Clustering (MVC) has garnered increasing attention in recent years. It is capable of partitioning data samples into distinct groups by learning a consensus representation. However, a significant challenge remains: the problem of untrustworthy fusion. This problem primarily arises from two key factors: 1) Existing methods often ignore the presence of inherent noise within individual views; 2) In traditional MVC methods using Contrastive Learning (CL), similarity computations typically rely on different views of the same instance, while neglecting the structural information from nearest neighbors within the same cluster. Consequently, this leads to the wrong direction for multi-view fusion. To address this problem, we present a novel Trusted Hierarchical Contrastive Representation Learning (THCRL). It consists of two key modules. Specifically, we propose the Deep Symmetry Hierarchical Fusion (DSHF) module, which leverages the UNet architecture integrated with multiple denoising mechanisms to achieve trustworthy fusion of multi-view data. Furthermore, we present the Average K-Nearest Neighbors Contrastive Learning (AKCL) module to align the fused representation with the view-specific representation. Unlike conventional strategies, AKCL enhances representation similarity among samples belonging to the same cluster, rather than merely focusing on the same sample across views, thereby reinforcing the confidence of the fused representation. Extensive experiments demonstrate that THCRL achieves the state-of-the-art performance in deep MVC tasks.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新颖的方法THCRL，旨在解决多视图聚类中的不可信融合问题，通过引入DSHF和AKCL模块，分别实现了多视图数据的可信融合和融合表示与视图特定表示的对齐。
AI.motivation: 当前的多视图聚类方法通常忽略视图内的固有噪声，且在使用对比学习的传统方法中，相似性计算忽视了同一簇内最近邻的结构信息，导致不可信融合。
AI.method: THCRL方法包含两个关键模块：DSHF（深度对称层次融合）模块利用UNet架构结合多种去噪机制实现多视图数据的可信融合；AKCL（平均最近邻对比学习）模块使融合表示与视图特定表示对齐。
AI.result: extensive experiments demonstrated that THCRL achieved state-of-the-art performance in deep multi-view clustering tasks.
AI.conclusion: THCRL方法通过引入DSHF和AKCL模块，在解决多视图聚类中的不可信融合问题上取得了较好的效果，是深多视图聚类任务中的先进方法。

title: TempPerturb-Eval: On the Joint Effects of Internal Temperature and External Perturbations in RAG Robustness
summary: The evaluation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems typically examines retrieval quality and generation parameters like temperature in isolation, overlooking their interaction. This work presents a systematic investigation of how text perturbations (simulating noisy retrieval) interact with temperature settings across multiple LLM runs. We propose a comprehensive RAG Perturbation-Temperature Analysis Framework that subjects retrieved documents to three distinct perturbation types across varying temperature settings. Through extensive experiments on HotpotQA with both open-source and proprietary LLMs, we demonstrate that performance degradation follows distinct patterns: high-temperature settings consistently amplify vulnerability to perturbations, while certain perturbation types exhibit non-linear sensitivity across the temperature range. Our work yields three key contributions: (1) a diagnostic benchmark for assessing RAG robustness, (2) an analytical framework for quantifying perturbation-temperature interactions, and (3) practical guidelines for model selection and parameter tuning under noisy retrieval conditions.

AI.tldr: 该研究系统地分析了文本扰动（模拟嘈杂检索）与温度设置之间的交互作用，并提出了一个全面的RAG扰动-温度分析框架。研究发现高温度设置会一致地放大对扰动的脆弱性，并且某些类型的扰动在温度范围内具有非线性敏感性。贡献包括诊断基准、分析框架和在嘈杂检索条件下的模型选择和参数调整指南。
AI.motivation: 当前评估RAG系统的方法通常将检索质量和生成参数（如温度）分开评估，忽略了它们之间的交互作用。该研究旨在补充这一不足，通过实验研究它们之间的交互作用，提供更全面的分析框架。
AI.method: 该研究通过应用一个全面的RAG扰动-温度分析框架，利用不同类型的文本扰动和多个温度设置，在HotpotQA数据集上进行了大量实验，使用了开源和专有LLM。
AI.result: 研究表明，高温度设置会持续放大对抗扰动的脆弱性，特定类型的扰动在温度范围内表现出非线性敏感性。通过实验获得了具体的结果，验证了假设。
AI.conclusion: 研究提出了三个关键贡献：（1）评估RAG鲁棒性的诊断基准；（2）定量分析扰动-温度交互作用的分析框架；（3）在噪声检索条件下进行模型选择和参数调整的实用指南。

title: POLARIS: Projection-Orthogonal Least Squares for Robust and Adaptive Inversion in Diffusion Models
summary: The Inversion-Denoising Paradigm, which is based on diffusion models, excels in diverse image editing and restoration tasks. We revisit its mechanism and reveal a critical, overlooked factor in reconstruction degradation: the approximate noise error. This error stems from approximating the noise at step t with the prediction at step t-1, resulting in severe error accumulation throughout the inversion process. We introduce Projection-Orthogonal Least Squares for Robust and Adaptive Inversion (POLARIS), which reformulates inversion from an error-compensation problem into an error-origin problem. Rather than optimizing embeddings or latent codes to offset accumulated drift, POLARIS treats the guidance scale ω as a step-wise variable and derives a mathematically grounded formula to minimize inversion error at each step. Remarkably, POLARIS improves inversion latent quality with just one line of code. With negligible performance overhead, it substantially mitigates noise approximation errors and consistently improves the accuracy of downstream tasks.

AI.tldr: POLARIS通过重新定义反演过程为误差源而非误差补偿，并引入数学上合理的公式，每步最小化反演误差，以解决重建退化中的近似噪声误差问题。
AI.motivation: 当前的反演去噪方法未能充分考虑到近似噪声误差对重建质量的影响，尤其是在反演过程中误差累积导致的问题。
AI.method: POLARIS提出了一种新方法，通过引入投影-正交最小二乘误差源模型，以每步优化的方式解决反演过程中产生的误差。
AI.result: POLARIS仅需一行代码即可显著提高反演潜变量质量，并且几乎不增加性能开销，有效减少了近似噪声误差，提升了下游任务的准确性。
AI.conclusion: POLARIS展示了在基于扩散模型的反演去噪中的一种新颖且有效的解决方案，为相关研究和应用提供了改进方向。

title: RoboDriveVLM: A Novel Benchmark and Baseline towards Robust Vision-Language Models for Autonomous Driving
summary: Current Vision-Language Model (VLM)-based end-to-end autonomous driving systems often leverage large language models to generate driving decisions directly based on their understanding of the current scene. However, such systems introduce multiple risks in real-world driving scenarios. To evaluate whether VLMs are truly viable for autonomous driving, we introduce RoboDriveBench, the first robustness benchmark focused on end-to-end trajectory prediction tasks. This benchmark systematically evaluates two critical categories of real-world challenges for VLM-based end-to-end autonomous driving systems through 11 simulated scenarios encompassing various corruption types, including 6 scenarios of sensor corruption caused by environmental variations, along with 5 cases of prompt corruption resulting from human intervention and data transmission failures. Each corruption type includes 250 unique driving scenarios and 5,689 frames, resulting in 64,559 total trajectory prediction cases per evaluation. To overcome these real-world challenges, we propose a novel VLM-based autonomous driving framework called RoboDriveVLM, which enhances robustness by mapping more multimodal data-e.g., lidar and radar-into a unified latent space. Furthermore, we introduce a new Test-Time Adaptation (TTA) method based on cross-modal knowledge distillation to improve the robustness of VLM-based autonomous driving systems. Through extensive experiments, our work highlights the limitations of current VLM-based end-to-end autonomous driving systems and provides a more reliable solution for real-world deployment. Source code and datasets will be released.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了一个新的基准RoboDriveBench，用于评估基于Vision-Language Model (VLM)的自动驾驶系统的鲁棒性，通过模拟多种传感器和提示的失败场景进行评估。同时，提出了RoboDriveVLM框架以及一种新的Test-Time Adaptation (TTA)方法，以增强VLM在自动驾驶中的鲁棒性。
AI.motivation: 当前的基于VLM的自动驾驶系统存在多方面风险，为了验证它们是否适用于真实的自动驾驶场景，本文提出了RoboDriveBench以评估基于VLM的端到端轨迹预测系统的鲁棒性。
AI.method: RoboDriveBench通过模拟传感器和提示的多种失败情况来评估VLM的鲁棒性。RoboDriveVLM框架通过将多种传感器数据映射到统一的潜在空间和引入基于跨模态知识蒸馏的Test-Time Adaptation (TTA)方法来增强系统的鲁棒性。
AI.result: 通过RoboDriveBench的评估和RoboDriveVLM框架的应用，该研究揭示了当前基于VLM的自动驾驶系统的局限性，并提供了更可靠的解决方案以供实际部署。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出了一种新的鲁棒性基准RoboDriveBench，并开发了RoboDriveVLM框架和基于跨模态知识蒸馏的TTA方法，增强了基于VLM的自动驾驶系统的鲁棒性。

title: Generalist Large Language Models Outperform Clinical Tools on Medical Benchmarks
summary: Specialized clinical AI assistants are rapidly entering medical practice, often framed as safer or more reliable than general-purpose large language models (LLMs). Yet, unlike frontier models, these clinical tools are rarely subjected to independent, quantitative evaluation, creating a critical evidence gap despite their growing influence on diagnosis, triage, and guideline interpretation. We assessed two widely deployed clinical AI systems (OpenEvidence and UpToDate Expert AI) against three state-of-the-art generalist LLMs (GPT-5, Gemini 3 Pro, and Claude Sonnet 4.5) using a 1,000-item mini-benchmark combining MedQA (medical knowledge) and HealthBench (clinician-alignment) tasks. Generalist models consistently outperformed clinical tools, with GPT-5 achieving the highest scores, while OpenEvidence and UpToDate demonstrated deficits in completeness, communication quality, context awareness, and systems-based safety reasoning. These findings reveal that tools marketed for clinical decision support may often lag behind frontier LLMs, underscoring the urgent need for transparent, independent evaluation before deployment in patient-facing workflows.

AI.tldr: 研究评估了两个广泛使用的临床AI系统（OpenEvidence和UpToDate Expert AI）与三种顶尖的通用大型语言模型（GPT-5、Gemini 3 Pro和Claude Sonnet 4.5），结果表明通用模型的性能优于临床工具，揭示了临床辅助工具可能落后于前沿LLMs的现状，强调了在实际应用前需要透明、独立的评估。
AI.motivation: 研究旨在填补临床专业AI工具缺乏独立、定量评估的空白，这些工具在诊断、分流和指南解释中日益发挥着重要作用。
AI.method: 研究使用了一个包含1,000项任务的小型基准测试，结合了MedQA（医学知识）和HealthBench（临床一致性）评估。
AI.result: 通用模型在所有检测领域均优于临床工具，GPT-5表现最佳，而OpenEvidence和UpToDate在完整性和沟通质量、情境意识及系统性安全推理方面存在不足。
AI.conclusion: 研究结果指出，临床辅助工具可能在决策支持功能上落后于前沿LLMs，强调了在临床工作流程中使用前进行透明、独立评估的紧迫性。

title: Pore-scale Image Patch Dataset and A Comparative Evaluation of Pore-scale Facial Features
summary: The weak-texture nature of facial skin regions presents significant challenges for local descriptor matching in applications such as facial motion analysis and 3D face reconstruction. Although deep learning-based descriptors have demonstrated superior performance to traditional hand-crafted descriptors in many applications, the scarcity of pore-scale image patch datasets has hindered their further development in the facial domain. In this paper, we propose the PorePatch dataset, a high-quality pore-scale image patch dataset, and establish a rational evaluation benchmark. We introduce a Data-Model Co-Evolution (DMCE) framework to generate a progressively refined, high-quality dataset from high-resolution facial images. We then train existing SOTA models on our dataset and conduct extensive experiments. Our results show that the SOTA model achieves a FPR95 value of 1.91% on the matching task, outperforming PSIFT (22.41%) by a margin of 20.5%. However, its advantage is diminished in the 3D reconstruction task, where its overall performance is not significantly better than that of traditional descriptors. This indicates that deep learning descriptors still have limitations in addressing the challenges of facial weak-texture regions, and much work remains to be done in this field.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种针对面部细微结构数据稀缺问题的PorePatch数据集，并采用数据-模型协同进化框架生成高质量的数据，使深度学习模型在面部匹配任务中获得了优于传统手工程设计描述子的表现。
AI.motivation: 面部皮肤区域的微纹理特性给局部描述子匹配带来了挑战，特别是在面部动态分析和3D人脸重建的应用中。深学习基于的描述子在许多应用中表现得比传统手工构建的描述子更好，但由于缺乏毛孔级图像块的数据集，限制了它们在面部领域的进一步发展。
AI.method: 本文提出了一种PorePatch数据集，通过数据-模型协同进化框架生成高质量的数据，从而实现对该数据集进行深度学习模型训练及实验。
AI.result: 通过在提出的PorePatch数据集上训练现有最佳模型，我们发现模型在面部匹配任务中取得了FPR95为1.91%的结果，相比传统的PSIFT描述子（22.41%）有显著的性能提升。
AI.conclusion: 尽管在面部匹配任务中，深度学习描述子模型取得了较好的效果，但在3D重建任务中的表现并不明显优于传统描述子，表明在处理面部弱纹理区域问题上，深度学习描述子仍存在局限性，还需要更多工作来改进。

title: EZ-SP: Fast and Lightweight Superpoint-Based 3D Segmentation
summary: Superpoint-based pipelines provide an efficient alternative to point- or voxel-based 3D semantic segmentation, but are often bottlenecked by their CPU-bound partition step. We propose a learnable, fully GPU partitioning algorithm that generates geometrically and semantically coherent superpoints 13$\times$ faster than prior methods. Our module is compact (under 60k parameters), trains in under 20 minutes with a differentiable surrogate loss, and requires no handcrafted features. Combine with a lightweight superpoint classifier, the full pipeline fits in $<$2 MB of VRAM, scales to multi-million-point scenes, and supports real-time inference. With 72$\times$ faster inference and 120$\times$ fewer parameters, EZ-SP matches the accuracy of point-based SOTA models across three domains: indoor scans (S3DIS), autonomous driving (KITTI-360), and aerial LiDAR (DALES). Code and pretrained models are accessible at github.com/drprojects/superpoint_transformer.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种高效且轻量级的基于超点的3D语义分割方法，通过学习且完全在GPU上运行的分割算法，实现了比现有方法快13倍的超点生成，并且参数量少，适用于大规模点云场景。
AI.motivation: 现有的基于点或体素的3D语义分割方法在计算效率上受到限制，特别是CPU瓶颈问题。文章旨在设计一种更高效的方法，以提高3D语义分割的速度和效率。
AI.method: 由一个在GPU上学习的、完全无监督的分割算法组成，该算法能够生成几何上和语义上一致的超点，速度快13倍。该模块具有不到6万个参数，可以在不到20分钟内训练，并且无需手工设计特征。通过组合一个轻量级的超点分类器，整个管道可以适应小于2MB的VRAM，支持实时推理。
AI.result: 与现有基于点的方法相比，此方法在72倍更快的推理速度和120倍更少的参数下，仍能达到最先进的性能，适用于三种不同的场景：室内扫描S3DIS、自动驾驶KITT-360和航空激光雷达DALES。
AI.conclusion: 该技术能够快速生成几何和语义一致的超点，适用于大规模点云场景，支持实时推理，为3D语义分割提供了新的高效方法。

title: Sentiment Analysis and Emotion Classification using Machine Learning Techniques for Nagamese Language - A Low-resource Language
summary:
The Nagamese language, a.k.a Naga Pidgin, is an Assamese-lexified creole language developed primarily as a means of communication in trade between the people from Nagaland and people from Assam in the north-east India. Substantial amount of work in sentiment analysis has been done for resource-rich languages like English, Hindi, etc. However, no work has been done in Nagamese language. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first attempt on sentiment analysis and emotion classification for the Nagamese Language. The aim of this work is to detect sentiments in terms of polarity (positive, negative and neutral) and basic emotions contained in textual content of Nagamese language. We build sentiment polarity lexicon of 1,195 nagamese words and use these to build features along with additional features for supervised machine learning techniques using Na"ive Bayes and Support Vector Machines.
  Keywords: Nagamese, NLP, sentiment analysis, machine learning

AI.tldr: 该研究填补了西孟加拉语地区Nagamese语言情感分析的空白，构建了1195个Nagamese词汇的情感极性词典，并使用朴素贝叶斯和支持向量机等监督机器学习技术进行情感和情绪分类。
AI.motivation: 之前的关于情感分析的工作主要集中于资源丰富的语言，如英语和印地语，对于Nagamese语言的研究几乎是空白。该研究旨在填补这一空白，首次针对Nagamese语言进行情感分析和情绪分类。
AI.method: 研究人员构建了一个包含1195个Nagamese词汇的情感极性词典，并结合其他特征使用监督机器学习技术（包括朴素贝叶斯和支持向量机）进行情感分析。
AI.result: 该研究建立了一个Nagamese情感极性词典，并利用此词典和额外特征，通过机器学习模型实现了对Nagamese文本的情感和情绪分类。
AI.conclusion: 此项研究是首次针对Nagamese语言的情感分析和情绪分类，展示了机器学习方法在该领域中的应用潜力。

title: WiseEdit: Benchmarking Cognition- and Creativity-Informed Image Editing
summary: Recent image editing models boast next-level intelligent capabilities, facilitating cognition- and creativity-informed image editing. Yet, existing benchmarks provide too narrow a scope for evaluation, failing to holistically assess these advanced abilities. To address this, we introduce WiseEdit, a knowledge-intensive benchmark for comprehensive evaluation of cognition- and creativity-informed image editing, featuring deep task depth and broad knowledge breadth. Drawing an analogy to human cognitive creation, WiseEdit decomposes image editing into three cascaded steps, i.e., Awareness, Interpretation, and Imagination, each corresponding to a task that poses a challenge for models to complete at the specific step. It also encompasses complex tasks, where none of the three steps can be finished easily. Furthermore, WiseEdit incorporates three fundamental types of knowledge: Declarative, Procedural, and Metacognitive knowledge. Ultimately, WiseEdit comprises 1,220 test cases, objectively revealing the limitations of SoTA image editing models in knowledge-based cognitive reasoning and creative composition capabilities. The benchmark, evaluation code, and the generated images of each model will be made publicly available soon. Project Page: https://qnancy.github.io/wiseedit_project_page/.

AI.tldr: WiseEdit 是一个知识密集型基准测试，旨在全面评估基于认知和创意思维的图像编辑能力，包括深入的任务深度、广泛的知识广度以及难以单独完成的复杂任务。它涵盖三大类型的知识：陈述性、程序性及元认知知识，并包含1,220个测试案例，旨在客观揭示最先进的图像编辑模型在基于知识的认知推理和创造性的Composition能力上的局限。
AI.motivation: 现有的图像编辑模型虽然具备高级智能能力，但现有的基准测试无法全面评估这些能力。为了弥补这一缺陷，作者提出了WiseEdit，该测试旨在提供更广泛、更深入的评估，以便更好地理解模型在基于知识的认知推理和创意生成方面的能力。
AI.method: WiseEdit 通过三个递进步骤（警觉、解释和想象）来分解图像编辑任务，每个步骤都是对模型在特定步骤上完成挑战性的任务。同时，它还包含了复杂的任务，这些任务需要三个步骤的共同作用。此外，WiseEdit 还整合了三大类知识：陈述性知识、程序性知识和元认知知识。
AI.result: WiseEdit 包含1,220个测试案例，以客观地揭示当前最先进的图像编辑模型在基于知识的认知推理和创造性组成能力上的局限性。
AI.conclusion: WiseEdit 为评估高级认知和创意图像编辑能力提供了一个新的框架，有助于促进该领域的进一步研究和发展。

title: SUPERChem: A Multimodal Reasoning Benchmark in Chemistry
summary: Current benchmarks for evaluating the chemical reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) are limited by oversimplified tasks, lack of process-level evaluation, and misalignment with expert-level chemistry skills. To address these issues, we introduce SUPERChem, a benchmark of 500 expert-curated reasoning-intensive chemistry problems, covering diverse subfields and provided in both multimodal and text-only formats. Original content and an iterative curation pipeline eliminate flawed items and mitigate data contamination. Each problem is paired with an expert-authored solution path, enabling Reasoning Path Fidelity (RPF) scoring to evaluate reasoning quality beyond final-answer accuracy. Evaluations against a human baseline of 40.3% accuracy show that even the best-performing model, GPT-5 (High), reaches only 38.5%, followed closely by Gemini 2.5 Pro (37.9%) and DeepSeek-V3.1-Think (37.3%). SUPERChem elicits multi-step, multimodal reasoning, reveals model-dependent effects of visual information, and distinguishes high-fidelity reasoners from heuristic ones. By providing a challenging benchmark and a reliable evaluation framework, SUPERChem aims to facilitate the advancement of LLMs toward expert-level chemical intelligence. The dataset of the benchmark is available at https://huggingface.co/datasets/ZehuaZhao/SUPERChem.

AI.tldr: SUPERChem 是一个包含500个专家策划、涵盖多个化学子领域的推理问题基准，这些问题不仅可以用于多模态和纯文本格式。通过引入Reasoning Path Fidelity (RPF)评分法，评估模型的推理质量而非仅限于最终答案的准确性。该基准挑战了当前最佳模型GPT-5 (High) 和 Gemini 2.5 Pro 的能力，展示了在多步、多模态推理方面的能力差异。
AI.motivation: 目前对大型语言模型（LLMs）的化学推理能力评估基准主要存在任务简单化、缺乏过程评估、以及与专家级化学技能不匹配的问题。SUPERChem旨在解决这些问题，提供了一个具有挑战性的基准，推动该领域向专家级化学智能迈进。
AI.method: SUPERChem 涵盖了多个化学子领域，包含500个专家策划的问题，这些问题以多模态和纯文本形式提供。每个问题都配有一个专家撰写的解题路径，通过引入Reasoning Path Fidelity (RPF)评分法，评估模型的推理过程.
AI.result: 在与人类基准（40.3%）的比较中，即使最佳模型GPT-5 (High) 也只能达到38.5%，紧随其后的是Gemini 2.5 Pro (37.9%)和DeepSeek-V3.1-Think (37.3%)。这表明，现有的大型语言模型在多步、多模态推理能力方面仍存在差距。
AI.conclusion: SUPERChem 旨在通过提供一个具有挑战性的基准和可靠的评估框架，推动大型语言模型向专家级化学智能的进步，以促进该领域的研究和发展。

title: Better, Stronger, Faster: Tackling the Trilemma in MLLM-based Segmentation with Simultaneous Textual Mask Prediction
summary: Integrating segmentation into Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) presents a core trilemma: simultaneously preserving dialogue ability, achieving high segmentation performance, and ensuring fast inference. Prevailing paradigms are forced into a compromise. Embedding prediction methods introduce a conflicting pixel-level objective that degrades the MLLM's general dialogue abilities. The alternative, next-token prediction, reframes segmentation as an autoregressive task, which preserves dialogue but forces a trade-off between poor segmentation performance with sparse outputs or prohibitive inference speeds with rich ones. We resolve this trilemma with all-mask prediction, a novel paradigm that decouples autoregressive dialogue generation from non-autoregressive mask prediction. We present STAMP: Simultaneous Textual All-Mask Prediction, an MLLM that embodies this paradigm. After generating a textual response, STAMP predicts an entire segmentation mask in a single forward pass by treating it as a parallel "fill-in-the-blank" task over image patches. This design maintains the MLLM's dialogue ability by avoiding conflicting objectives, enables high segmentation performance by leveraging rich, bidirectional spatial context for all mask tokens, and achieves exceptional speed. Extensive experiments show that STAMP significantly outperforms state-of-the-art methods across multiple segmentation benchmarks, providing a solution that excels in dialogue, segmentation, and speed without compromise.

AI.tldr: STAMP 提出了一种新颖的多模态大语言模型架构，通过将分段预测与非自回归掩码预测分离，避免了对话能力和分段性能之间的冲突，实现了高效的分段任务和对话生成。
AI.motivation: 解决多模态大语言模型在保持对话能力、高分段性能和快速推理速度之间的核心难题。
